articles.content:
GIs do violence to South Koreans
    Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- Soldiers under the 8th U.S. army did violence to innocent South Koreans in Seoul on Dec. 15, according to KBS of South Korea.
 At dawn three U.S. soldiers drove a car while drunk and beat those passengers who were following and protesting.    
 They justified their criminal act, refusing to get their drinking checked even after being arrested by police.
